all_paragraphs: Race bar chart is a very easy tool to compare quantities which varies with time. In simple terms, it is a bar chart incorporated with a time axis.
In this article, I will explain how to prepare a COVID-19 Visualization using Flourish App. The final product looks as shown below:

Signing up for ‘Flourish’ is very simple procedure like signing up for any other service. Like Tableau, flourish has free and paid versions, the downside of free version, just like the case of Tableau or GitHub free version is that the data needs to be kept public. If you have highly sensitive information consider signing up for paid version.Files in excel or csv format can be uploaded to Flourish. Note that for making a Bar Race Chart, column headers should be time(date, year, rounds etc.)Apart from the bar labels, category and image can also be incorporated in Flourish, which are optional. If category is available, bar coloring can be based on category. For adding image(country flag/player image, club crest etc.), image url needs to be provided.Sign up to Flourish(Not Affiliate Link).

COVID-19 daily statistics for all countries is available in John Hopkins University Github repo. We are interested in the daily global time series data which is available in the repo, which looks like as below.

The data from JHU has time as column headers as required for Flourish. However, note that there are columns like Lat and Long, which are not required. Also for some countries, the data is segregated based on Province/State which needs to aggregated based on Country. Hence, the data needs to be pre-processed for flourish. Further, Image URL (country flags url) and Region names are also added during preprocessing.
Check out my Kaggle notebook below for another example:

Log into Flourish app and click on ‘New Visualization’. It will take you the list of all available templates in Flourish (They have an exhaustive collection of data visualization templates which are very easy to use). Scroll down and click on ‘Bar Chart Race’. It will display a sample bar chart with some dummy data. Click on ‘data’ on top left of the visualization to view the data used for current visualization. To upload your data, click on ‘upload data’ and select the file to upload and click OK.Change the mode to preview. Voila! your visualization is ready!

There are many aspects of bar chart which can be customized like the Number of Bars, Bar Colors, Layout of the chart, Length of timeline etc. These options are available on the right side of the visualization.
Once you are happy with the visualization, it can be published just by clicking Export and Publish. You can also get embed link which can be used to embed the visualization in your website.

Net net, it is pretty simple!Flourish is not just the only app which can be used for making race chart but it is by far the most easiest one I have come across.Race Bar chart can be prepared using python or r which involves a lot of coding. In Tableau also race chart can be prepared which, in my opinion can be very overwhelming for a beginner.If you have excel/csv file in proper format for Flourish, making a race chart in Flourish is just child’s play.
If you are interested in visual tutorial, you can check out this YouTube video where I have explained how to make a race chart.
All code and resources can be accessed in this GitHub repo.
